item.title: Aros Cryo-EM Update
item.description:
Simon Sommehage October 30, 2025 (Thu), 18:38 Microscope: Krios G4 9688 exposures / movies Example micrograph
(Green numbers indicate the estimated resolution (top), the class ID (bottom) and the number of particles contained in this class (in brackets))
Aβ42 Type 2 Fibril as determined by (Yang et al., 2022) (2D class averages marked in green)
Tau Paired Helical Filament (PHF) as determined previously by (Fitzpatrick et al., 2017) (marked in blue) "Eye-Lashe" polymorph of unknown Identity (marked in red)

Until now: Low resolution (~10 Å). We are working on an improved reconstruction Characteristic backbone already visible
Exemplary 2D class averages of eye-lash polymorph(s) Asymmetric polymorphs with very thin and very wide regions visible in the micrographs and 2D class averages (similar to eye lashes, which indicates an oblate cross-section The appearance of this polymorph has too our knowledge not been described in the literature. We compared the present 2D classes to several others 2D classes of whichever amyloid fibril in the literature and couldn't find a correspondence Right now we are working on obtaining a 3D reconstruction Might be more than one polymorph
